header.comment:
The colony's operating system has been enhanced and all aspects of colony life benefit from the extra computing power.

  • Any one Command Crew roll during the End of Cycle can be Pushed.

A long way from Gateway Station, it's good to have first rate medical facilities on hand.

  • +1 modification to MEDICAL AID rolls when in the colony

How can we make the discoveries we are here to make if we don't have the best equipment?

  • +1 modification to OBSERVATION when involved in scientific analysis

Important systems can diagnose and repair themselves.

  • +3 modification whenever the colony needs to make a Maintenance attribute roll to resist the effects of disasters like earthquakes and storms

A place for corporations to work their magic, with whizzy schemes to further indebt the workers.

  • +1 modification for the Corporate Director's roll at the End of Cycle

What better way to make sure the people hear what you want them to hear. A happy worker is an efficient worker.

  • +1 modification to MANIPULATION rolls when someone in authority or with influence tries to manipulate a crowd

A local radio station that broadcasts official information gets listened to ...

  • +1 modification for the Colony Supervisor's roll at the End of Cycle

Deep core sampling is a great way to hit paydirt deep beneath the surface.

  • +1 modification for the Prospector General's roll at the End of Cycle

If all else fails ...

  • +1 modification to MANIPULATION when interrogating a prisoner

Life can be deadly, and having a safe haven to escape to makes everyone feel better.

  • The colony has emergency shelters with power, food and cryosleep pods. +1 modification to SURVIVAL rolls at the colony

It helps if you can make your own compression suits, survival gear, and some light protection weapons too.

  • The colony can manufacture light equipment and products.

Always going to need factories or farms ...

  • +1 modification to HEAVY MACHINERY tests that relate to the workings or output of the colony

The colony is prone to breaking down. Adding layers of armor or steel supports can only be a good thing.

  • You may re-roll one End of Cycle Colony Incident roll.

Let's employ more workers to keep this place in good running order.

  • +1 modification for the Chief Engineer's roll at the End of Cycle

Need to have somewhere to hawk your goods.

  • +1 point to an attribute, rolled randomly

A pharmacology unit and factory that can produce a variety of chemicals.

  • The colony can synthesize drugs and medical supplies

Automated drones go out and do the legwork, so your wild- catters can go straight to the hot finds.

  • +1 modification to OBSERVATION rolls when prospecting

There's a lot of unknown shit out there so having a quarantine system is a no-brainer.

  • +1 modification for the Science Advisor's roll at the End of Cycle

All work and no play makes Jane a shit worker.

  • +1 modification for the Civil Marshal's roll at the End of Cycle

Why not make our colony out of systems that don't break down half so much? That way the maintenance job is much easier ...

  • +1 modification to COMTECH rolls when performing colony repairs or maintenance tasks

Robotic workers might increase productivity but they put some people out of a job.

  • +1 modification for the Union Steward's roll at the End of Cycle

A place to build small vehicles and tools.

  • The colony can build its own tools and small vehicles (if combined with the Tractor Assembly the colony can build small low orbit vessels).

You can't prospect or farm all that land if you don't have any working rovers or tractors ...

  • The colony can build its own tractors and industrial vehicles (if combined with the Tooling Workshop the colony can build small low orbit vessels).

Bringing stuff for us-whatever it is we'll order and orbital support to your colonists when in transit is a great benefit and prevents those pesky mid-air collisions.

  • +1 modification to PILOTING rolls when traveling within range of the colony.

Anyone can mass produce crap, here we will focus on the high- end stuff we can't get from elsewhere.

  • +1 Productivity
  • +1 Science
  • -1 Economy

We must keep those farms working, fix the tractors, service their suits, and keep working!

  • +1 Potential
  • +1 Maintenance
  • -1 Economy

Ethics? What about them? Scientific discovery is the master and we don't let silly things like ethics get in the way ...

  • +1 Science
  • +1 Economy
  • -1 Spirit

Go out and find stuff for us- whatever it is we'll pay big.

  • -1 Economy
  • +1 Productivity
  • +1 Spirit

We are better off working together and pooling our wealth, for the good of the colony.

  • +1 Economy
  • +1 Productivity
  • -1 Potential

Living close to each other can be hard, but if you're a real community then it's expected.

  • -1 Spirit
  • +1 Maintenance
  • +1 Economy

Fracking, mantle breaking, explosive mining: it's all acceptable as we strip this planet clean.

  • +1 Potential
  • +1 Productivity
  • -1 Spirit

When the work has to be done some- times there's no option but to go to double shifts all round.

  • +1 Productivity
  • +1 Economy
  • -1 Spirit

Have kids!

  • +2 Science
  • +1 Spirit
  • -1 Productivity
  • -1 Maintenance

Get out there and find what this place has to offer-we guarantee it's yours to sell once we have assessed it.

  • +2 Potential
  • +1 Science
  • -1 Productivity
  • -1 Maintenance

It's each colonist for themselves, let capitalism save us all.

 

  • +2 Economy
  • +1 Potential
  • -1 Science
  • -1 Maintenance

Taking care of the peoples' health is good for everyone.

  • +1 Spirit
  • +1 Economy
  • -1 Potential

If the people fix up their homes themselves it makes the maintenance job a mite easier.

  • +1 Maintenance
  • +1 Spirit
  • -1 Productivity

Focus on the discoveries this new planet has to offer.

  • +1 Science
  • +1 Potential
  • -1 Maintenance

A competition of various games, to get the different departments mixing, can only be good for morale.

  • +3 Spirit
  • -1 Maintenance
  • -1 Science

If food is running low we have to ration it for the good of the colony.

  • +1 Economy
  • +1 Science
  • -1 Spirit

Encourage more trade through a super low tax.

  • +1 Economy
  • +1 Spirit
  • -1 Science

Don't worry about that fancy stuff, just pump out masses of the cheap shit.

  • +1 Productivity
  • +1 Maintenance

Anyone can knock on the command team's door and tell them what's what.

  • +1 Spirit
  • +1 Potential
  • -1 Productivity

We get nowhere unless the colony keeps us all safe and secure.

  • +1 Maintenance
  • +1 Spirit
  • -1 Productivity

It might be a risk but our research will go a lot faster if we share our findings with our corporate and government colleagues back home.

  • +1 Science
  • +1 Potential
  • -1 Economy

There's too much shit that needs attention, so just focus on keeping the wind out and the lights on.

  • +2 Maintenance
  • -1 Science

There's too much to do but it's gotta be done-just keep at it 24/7.

  • +2 Maintenance
  • +1 Productivity
  • -1 Potential
  • -1 Spirit

There's no space for illness or family life, zero tolerance for anything other than the success of the colony.

  • +2 Productivity
  • +1 Economy
  • -1 Spirit
  • -1 Science

Trade works best when you can control the supply, the market and the price ...

  • +2 Economy
  • +1 Productivity
  • -1 Spirit

A sustained period of watching the workers is surely going to help find any troublemakers.

  • +2 Economy
  • -1 Spirit
  • -1 Potential

Our team can't cope, so let's buy in an offworld company to come and fix things up.

  • +2 Maintenance
  • +1 Productivity
  • -1 Economy

Something's gone bad somewhere, the maintenance team must throw everything at it right away.

  • +2 Maintenance

At holiday time it's important to have fun and create a happy sense of community.

  • +2 Spirit
  • +1 Productivity
  • -1 Science

The prospectors here are busy up to the eyeballs, so why not buy-in some off-planet exper- tise to do some heavy lifting?

  • +2 Potential
  • +1 Productivity
  • -1 Science

Something needs all our attention for a short span, so make it so!

  • +2 Science
  • +1 Economy
  • -1 Productivity

The local wildcatters are lazy. Send an industrial team out to do some real surveying.

  • +2 Potential
  • +1 Science
  • -1 Maintenance

What the Marshal says goes-they're in charge now.

  • -1 Spirit
  • +1 Economy
  • +1 Productivity
  • -1 Science

New opportunities have opened up so get out there and make the most of it!

  • +2 Potential
  • +1 Productivity

You don't have to take the crap the Company sends, you can source your own supplies and get better stuff more cheaply

  • +3 Maintenance
  • +1 Economy
  • -1 Potential
  • -1 Science

Let's get volunteers to come and join us ...

  • +1 Potential
  • +1 Spirit

What better way to survey a big chunk of this rock?

  • +3 Potential
  • +1 Science
  • -1 Economy
  • -1 Maintenance

There's too much work and too little time. Let's flash some cash and get contractors in to do the job for us.

  • +3 Productivity
  • +1 Maintenance
  • -1 Economy
  • -1 Spirit

There's some research that is too hot to hold-it needs to be sent to the Company in full.

  • +3 Science
  • +1 Economy
  • -2 Potential

A desperate way to increase the working population by getting the Corporation to round up ne'er- do-wells and ship them out.

  • +2 Productivity
  • +1 Economy
  • -1 Spirit

Drop everything and survey a new part of the world, cuz you're not having much luck elsewhere.

  • +2 Potential
  • +1 Economy
  • -1 Productivity

Let's tell the people what's going on, keep them informed and let them have a say!

  • +2 Spirit
  • +1 Potential
  • -1 Productivity

They aren't worth much but it's all we can get our hands on-let's dig those raw materials up and sell them back to the Company.

  • +3 Economy
  • +1 Potential
  • -1 Maintenance
  • -1 Productivity

Progress is much faster if.you don't follow pages and pages of pointless safety measures.

  • +2 Science
  • +1 Potential
  • -1 Spirit

This world-building venture is still new, it's well worth studying the effects on those who are building these new worlds.

  • +1 Science
  • +1 Spirit

When running low you must call the Company to send a supply ship or two.

  • +1 Economy
  • +1 Maintenance

Let's train the colonists to do some basic repairs themselves. It's an effort up front but the benefits will be felt down the road.

  • +2 Maintenance
  • +1 Spirit
  • -1 Productivity

Encourage the colonists to look after themselves, have a good work-life balance and seek health and welfare advice.

  • +1 Spirit
  • +1 Science

comment.value:
This Chemical Biological Radiological and Nuclear Detection Kit includes a Geiger counter, a biological and chemical agent diagnostic device, four doses of neurotoxin inhibitors, four emergency respirators (good for one Turn each before they need to be recharged), a pair of acid proof gloves and goggles, syringes, sampling tools, chemical detection paper, and four heat resistant specimen jars.

Using this kit automatically detects the current Radiation Level and any chemical or biological pathogen at the users location. 

It also gives the user a +2 modification to any Sickness Roll.
comment.label: Text

notes.notes:
This Chemical Biological Radiological and Nuclear Detection Kit includes a Geiger counter, a biological and chemical agent diagnostic device, four doses of neurotoxin inhibitors, four emergency respirators (good for one Turn each before they need to be recharged), a pair of acid proof gloves and goggles, syringes, sampling tools, chemical detection paper, and four heat resistant specimen jars.

 

Using this kit automatically detects the current Radiation Level and any chemical or biological pathogen at the user’s location. 

 

It also gives the user a +2 modification to any Sickness Roll.

comment.value:
Sometimes its damn cold on whatever frigid ball youve been dropped on.
Other times, your lieutenant is too cheap to warm up your frigates life support past bare minimums.
In either case, wearing one of these heated hoodies gives a +2 bonus to STAMINA rolls made to resist the effects of severe cold.
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
Access and process date (Comtech roll).

A computer terminal is any colony, starship, or station based electronic hardware that can access and process data via keyboard or voice commands and monitor, or hologram. Using the right codes and Comtech rolls at a terminal can potentially give you access to whatever MU/TH/UR or A.P.O.L.L.O. knows.

Cost varies.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: These thermal-regulating undersuits come in a variety of blues, grays, and emergency oranges.  They add a +1 modification to STAMINA when resisting heat, cold, and vacuum.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: This doubled-sided wildcatter’s tool includes a collapsible garden fork on one side and a shovel on the other. Both can also be used as close combat weapons. Wildcatters will heat up their spade, turning the shovel into a make-shift cooking pan for grub. So, when you are breaking up soil for samples all day and unearth a critter’s burrow, you can dig it out of its hole, kill it, and then fry it up—all with your damn trusty fork and spade.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: This tripod winch-and-cable device was developed so that prospectors could inspect newly dug mining shafts with their hands free. Also used for rappel and rescue ops, the folding winch gives a +2 modification to MOBILITY rolls when hooked in on the folding winch’s polymer climbing rope.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: This large waterproof backpack comes standard equipped with a medkit and Supply rating 6 worth of food and water. In addition, the pack allows you to carry two more regular-sized items than normal without being over-encumbered.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: Commonly mounted under the barrel of a Rexim RXF-M5, the LAG acts as a focusing mechanism. This light dial can control the intensity of the energy beam. With it installed, the laser can be changed in intensity from a blinding light (with a −1 modification to OBSERVATION for anyone within one zone of target) to an armor punching weapon (adds +1 damage, but a Stress Die must be rolled after each shot—on   the power is drained). Using an RXF with a LAG set to higher levels is dangerous in pressurized environments. Be careful—you don’t need to shoot a hole in the hull and then blow your ass through it one cheek at a time.
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
A marines got to wear the right footwear for the right job. While M3Bs will do on the flight deck and in your everyday barracks, youll want a pair of M7s for a prolonged stay in a hot and moist environment (the alternative could be foot rot).

Best strap up your M8A2s in cold weather scenarios, unless you like frostbite and arent too fond of keeping your toes (STAMINA +1 to resist cold).

The M11s are the best if youre going for a dipthey add +2 to underwater MOBILITY rolls.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: Surplus military footwear is used by colonies and explorers on rough and tumble frontier worlds.  M7s are needed for a prolonged stay in a hot and moist environment (the alternative could be foot rot).
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
A marines got to wear the right footwear for the right job. While M3Bs will do on the flight deck and in your everyday barracks, youll want a pair of M7s for a prolonged stay in a hot and moist environment (the alternative could be foot rot).

Best strap up your M8A2s in cold weather scenarios, unless you like frostbite and arent too fond of keeping your toes (STAMINA +1 to resist cold).

The M11s are the best if youre going for a dipthey add +2 to underwater MOBILITY rolls.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: This set of heavy mining equipment adds a +2 modification to any mining related HEAVY MACHINERY roll. It includes hammers, wrenches, chisels, and pickaxes—many of which can be used as weapons in a pinch.
comment.label: Text

name: Omni-Tech SDDG Sonic Deterrent Defense Grid

comment.value: A perimeter fence set up to protect a colony from indigenous species, the SDDG uses ultrasonics to keep the pests at bay. Anyone getting within SHORT range of the barrier without ear protection must roll STAMINA each Round or suffer +1 STRESS LEVEL and make a Panic Roll. Cost is for a 9 × 9 meter enclosure that can be expanded by additional 3 meter fence increments at an extra $10,000 per extension. These grids can be hooked up to an independent power supply, run off a colony’s generator, or hooked up to vehicle or starship batteries.
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
One piece is a PDT wrist-worn accessory, the other is its dedicated locator.
Limited to a range of under 100 meters (four zones), the locator tube digitally displays its proximity to the bracelet and beeps louder as it approaches the transmitter.
If the tube is synced to an APC TAC center, full biometric data of the wearer can be accessed.
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
This high-polymer abrasion-resistant coated cable comes in 45-meter coils.
Just remember  abrasion resistant only means it wont fray easily and you wont cut up your bare hands climbing it.

Acid will still eat through it and youll still get a nasty rope burn sliding down it. 

Aint friction a bitch?
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
A high-powered flashlight, the TNR can be carried by hand or mounted to the shoulder bracket on APE Suits, M3, Kevlar, or 6B90 armors, allowing for hands free use.

The TNR removes the effect of darkness in a zone.
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
ARMOR PIERCING.

Less than 3 STR causes -1 modifier to RANGED WEAPONS.

Named after the pioneer colonist who made it popular, this handgun fires heavy high-velocity slugs capable of delivering devastating damage.  The recoil and muzzle blast are rough on anyone with a STR less than 3—causing a -1 modification to their RANGED COMBAT roll when firing it.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: The Frontier Revolver is a small handheld modern weapon that has high stopping power.  It was made popular on the frontier because of its low cost and easy to acquire owner's permits.  Unfortunately, reloading this weapon is slow and cumbersome, requiring a fast and a slow action (a full turn).
comment.label: Text

comment.value: Designed for non-lethal crowd control and used by Colonial Marshals, these kinetic impact shells work with shotguns and shockguns.  These rubber projectiles can incapacitate without killing.  Armor is doubled and any critical injuries from these rounds will be #16, #24, or #33 (equal chance of each).
comment.label: Text

comment.value: These emergency pistols can be found on nearly all military and civilian atmospheric vehicles.  Fired straight up into the air, an intensely bright M72A1 Starshell flare will illuminate one zone for D6 Rounds.  The pistol can be used as a weapon in a pinch—if a Starshell is fired directly at a human target, any critical injury inflicted will be #15.
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
ARMOR PIERCING

This standard mining laser is the Weyland-Yutani tool converted into a weapon by disgruntled miners during the 2106 uprising on Torin Prime.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: This updated version of the Rexim EVA Pistol is slowly being distributed to the Weyland-Yutani commercial fleet.  An RXF-M5A3 comes standard with a LAG light dial to increase damage and a 4x20 scope—if the scope is removed, the pistol has no bonus.
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
ARMOR PIERCING.

The most recent of the Grach series, the 4043 has overcome some of the earlier design flaws that made this the most beautiful but most under-performing pistol in the SOF armory.  The 4043 is the pinnacle of UPP small arms design, carried by senior officers who are forced to earn the right to use one.
comment.label: Text

name: Weyland ES-7 Supernova Dual-Action Electrostatic Shockgun

comment.value:
Stun effect, armor piercing.

These electrostatic kinetic energy projectile weapons fire armor piercing rounds that carry a stun charge. Any human target that suffers damage from an attack must make a hard STAMINA roll (2, doesnt count as an action) or be stunned for one Round, unable to act.
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
Fire Intensity 12

This century-old industrial flame thrower is seeing a comeback on Frontier colonies.  Heavy Incinerator Units are often used for clearing out dead foliage and burning disease ridden corpses.
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
ARMOR PIERCING, FULL AUTO

Underslung shotgun.

The 150 year old Weyland Corp Storm Rifle was a design ahead of its time.  In addition to being a state-of-the-art assault weapon, the Storm Rifle has a long-range sniper function capable of hitting a target five kilometers away.  Like most Weyland Corp products, this advanced and very expensive rifle was intended as a showcase of Weyland ingenuity.  It was never intended to be put into mass production, but a misread memo saw it distributed to over 7,000 colonial peace-keeping missions during the height of the Weyland Era.

The Storm Rifle was retired at the turn of the century.  When Armat was invited to create a weapon to replace the USCMC Harrington Assault Rifle in 2170, they drew upon the Storm Rifle's plans to make an updated and economized version of this masterpiece.
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
A focused charge designed for blast-mining, the B9 can be detonated by timer or remote.  The blast-mining charge has a Blast Power 9.

The intended target suffers an extra 2 points of damage automatically, and the damage caused is ARMOR PIERCING.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: The plastic suit provides protection from biochemical contaminants as long as no damage has pierced it.  Biohazard suits have a built-in comm unit and Air Supply 2.  They do not protect against the vacuum of space.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: A compression suit similar to the Mk.50 Compression Suit, the CCC4 is an unarmed and unarmored version of the Space Operating Forces CCC5.  Less cumbersome than the Mk.50, the CCC4's helmet viewport is comparatively small and gives a −1 modification to OBSERVATION rolls.
comment.label: Text

name: ECO2 All World Systems High Pressure Survival Suit

comment.value: Like the original ECO, this EVA hardsuit has fully articulated rotary joints and self actuating fingers, providing a limited range of mobility.  The ECO2 is designed for both vacuum and high pressure environments of up to 20,000 psi of pressure.  The helmet has a sophisticated heads up display, camera, and communications unit built in along with data ports to download recorded sensor, comm, and personal logs.  While the original ECO suit ships with a metallic crimson finish, the ECO2 is construction yellow.  The suit has hard points for attaching lines as well as its own thrusters for tether-free zero G maneuvers.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: Protects against gaseous and airborne chemical and biological contaminants, but not vacuum. Breath underwater. Air Supply of 2.
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
Built-in comm unit.

A relatively lightweight vest made of woven metal fibers, the Kevlar Riot Vest is the personnel armor of choice for law enforcement and security details throughout the colonies. It offers limited protection from bullets, knives, and shrapnel.
comment.label: Text

notes.notes: A relatively lightweight vest made of woven metal fibers, the Kevlar Riot Vest is the personnel armor of choice for law enforcement and security details throughout the colonies. It offers limited protection from bullets, knives, and shrapnel.

name: Omni-Tech EL7-HXC Emergency Landing Hex Capsule

comment.value:
Only protects against kinetic damage, fire, and radiation.

An expensive explorer's backpack-shaped device that can be attached to spacesuits like the Presidium or ECO2 (page 63 *** LINK *** ), the experimental EL7-HXC was originally developed in the 2130s and then shelved when it proved to be somewhat unreliable.  When deployed, the tension wires within the rods of the EL7 allow it to self-create a protective polygonal sphere of hexagonal shapes around the wearer.  The reactive converters generate a field of force between every six nodes.  The fields increase in power to repulse whatever force is thrown at them, essentially turning that energy against itself.

The device reacts to kinetic energy, so the effect of activating it can cause the sphere to bounce across the terrain.  EL7s have been used to soft-land during atmospheric entry and even to survive a nuclear blast, but were discontinued when their failure rate far exceeded the successes.  Too much energy directed at the converter nodes will overload them before they can push back, causing catastrophic failure.

Each time you suffer explosive or energy-based damage, Fire Intensity, or Radiation, roll ten Base Dice—if you roll one or more  , the damage or RAD is absorbed by the shield.  EL7s offer only limited protection against the vacuum of space.  Anyone in the EL7's field while in space can survive if they have a rebreather, but must make a STAMINA roll or lose consciousness from system shock.  The EL7 offers only 1 point of Armor against non-energy and blunt force attacks.  The system collapses if any damage is done, leaving the occupant on their own in the next round. Both Throop Rescue and Recovery and the UNISC Great Mother Mission use the EL7.
comment.label: Text

name: Presidium Mark VIII Advanced SE Suit

comment.value:
Base Armor Rating is 2.  Optional iridium coated vest adds an additional +1 to Armor.  Built-in comm unit.  Exoskeleton adds +1 to STRENGTH-based rolls. Built-in High-Beam Shoulder Lamp.

Originally designed for Peter Weyland's 2091 Prometheus mission, these nano-reinforced composite helmet and cadmium exoskeleton-equipped, form-fitting space suits are used for Geholgod Institute funded expeditions.  The exoskeleton gives a +1 modification to all STRENGTH-based skill rolls.  The Presidium Mk II-VIII all have dual video feeds from helmet and body cams.  The helmet's HUD tracks vital stats, environmental conditions, communications systems and data analysis.  An iridium-coated, laser-resistant light-weight armor vest can be added to the suit for an extra cost.
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
Armor Rating 1, Air Supply 3. 
Built-in comm unit. Protects against chemical and biological contaminants and radiation.

This sealed bodysuit acts as protection against hazardous materials. The suit protects fully against chemical and biological contaminants as long as nothing has pierced it. It also acts as armor against radiation. Each time you suffer a Radiation Point, roll six Base Diceif you roll one or more success, the Rad is absorbed by the suit. HAZMAT suits have a built-in comm unit and an Air Supply of 3. They do not protect against the vacuum of space.
comment.label: Text

notes.notes: This sealed bodysuit acts as protection against hazardous materials. The suit protects fully against chemical and biological contaminants as long as nothing has pierced it. It also acts as armor against radiation. Each time you suffer a Radiation Point, roll six Base Dice—if you roll one or more success, the Rad is absorbed by the suit. HAZMAT suits have a built-in comm unit and a limited air supply. They do not protect against the vacuum of space.

name: YAWS3 Yutani All Weather Singular Survival Shelter

comment.value:
Built in motion detector, PDT, rebreather, and medkit.  Delivers sedatives and stimulants as needed.  Includes 1 week consumables.  
Power Supply 6.  Weight increases to 4 when activated.  Roll Power Supply every Shift in extreme Temperatures.  Protects from vacuum.

Specifically designed for elite explorers, the Yutani All Weather Singular Survival Shelter is the ultimate survival kit.  YAWS3 ships compressed in a large duffle bag shape for ease of transport.  Sarcophagus-shaped when inflated, this environmental sleeping bag can regulate its internal temperature to a cool 22 degrees Celsius while external temperatures range from anywhere between −40 to 110 degrees Celsius.  Of course, the harder the system works, the faster it depletes its energy cells before it has a chance to recharge them.

The YAWS3 comes with a built-in medkit, one week's emergency rations, bedpan, PDT with double the usual range, and a simple rebreather mask with an internal atmosphere (Air Supply 12) and built-in battery (Power Supply 6).  Intravenous sedatives and protein solutions can extend one's stay up to a month.  The YAWS3 can be programmed to administer stimulants should its built-in motion detector register something.  The panel directly in front of the occupant's face is transparent, allowing them to stay somewhat aware of their surroundings and rescuers to confirm there is someone inside with a glance.  Prohibitively expensive, YAWS3 are used by Geholgod Expeditions and Throop Rescue and Recovery.

The YAWS3 is buoyant and will float in water, methane, and most other liquids.  While the YAWS3 is safe to use in a vacuum, the smallest of micrometeorites can puncture the triple-hulled inflatable and render it useless.
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
An inflatable flotation vest included in many vehicular survival kits, a life vest will keep its occupant buoyant in most liquids.
It includes a built-in flashlight and solar powered beacon transmitter that will broadcast PDT information over a two-kilometer radius.
comment.label: Text

terrain.value: Fault block mountains and cavernous mines
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value: This mineral-rich system, dominated by the planet Traon, has been leased to the Kelland Mining Company to exploit for Omni-Tech.  Large automated mining facilities cover Traon, extending deep beneath the surface.  The machines are powered by geothermal taps.  A contingent of 300 miners and wildcatters maintains the digs and scouts for new mining sites.

terrain.value: Forested valleys and rivers
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value: This mineral-rich system, dominated by the planet Traon, has been leased to the Kelland Mining Company to exploit for Omni-Tech.  Large automated mining facilities cover Traon, extending deep beneath the surface.  The machines are powered by geothermal taps.  A contingent of 300 miners and wildcatters maintains the digs and scouts for new mining sites.

climate.value: Rainy weather, breathable atmosphere Crude oil, neodymium
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Barren wasteland
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value:
Pype's Dream, destroyed.
Planet cleared for recolonization.
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value:
Located on the edge of known space and settled by famous industrialist and xenobotanist Henry De Pype, the colony on Rim was destroyed under mysterious circumstances in 2179.  A Colonial Marine contingent responding to a distress call found the colony of Pype's Dream to be suffering from a redacted outbreak.  The platoon came under attack by unknown forces and suffered near total losses.  To contain the epidemic, the atmospheric processor's reactor was purposely set to overload.  Only two survivors escaped Rim—USCMC Corporal David Wilks and a young colonist named Billie. Both were cleared of contagion some months later, sworn to never speak of the incident, and released.

While the planet's atmosphere was damaged by the reactor's explosion, the ECA has recently cleared the planet for recolonization.

The 340-kilometer area of the former colony is a radiation dead zone, so caution is recommended.  Nearing completion, the new colony is to be called Pype's Line for the many pumps and conduits used to siphon the crude oil deposits from deep under the irradiated zone safely to the colony kilometers away.

commonName.value:
GJ1187.03 SHNMN
SUEOS GRANDES, NEW LUHANSK, ROMASHKA OUTPOST, OTHER SETTLEMENTS
commonName.label: Text

terrain.value: Lush jungle to thick rainforests, fungi clumps, rocky mountains
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value: Five colonies and several small outposts, all destroyed. Planet quarantined. Population: Unknown, pre-bombing: 20,000+
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value:
[QUARANTINE ALERT]

Targeted by the Border Bombers, the UPP and Jùtóu Combine mining world of Shnmén was a vital source of the rare mineral eitr. The lush planet once supported several colonies along with some minor research outposts. The local fauna included meter-long flying insects and large predatory cats. Megafauna ranged from sauropods to large flying hawk-like creatures—all of which have now been mutated into monstrosities by the black pathogen dispersed in the atmosphere.

While the Border Bomber craft responsible for attacking the colonies here was destroyed by the multi-national marine force called the Jackals, only survivors from two settlements were confirmed to have been recovered. The various governments involved are currently in UNISC sessions to discuss the viability of nuking the planet.

The 340-kilometer area of the former colony is a radiation dead zone, so caution is recommended. Nearing completion, the new colony is to be called Pype's Line for the many pumps and conduits used to siphon the crude oil deposits from deep under the irradiated zone safely to the colony kilometers away.

terrain.value: Over-industrialized wasteland crisscrossed with deep strip-mine gouges
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value: While already considered a protectorate of the UPP, this former mining colony was annexed by them during the Frontier War.  Kawlang is an over-industrialized moon covered in factories and fog.  Factories here produce the weapons and machines of the UPPA war machine.

Sitting just outside 3WE space, GL268 is a yellow star with no planetary system.  There are no natural celestial bodies in the star's orbit—just a human-made deep-space transit space station.  Called Station 949, this large service terminal is considered the hub to the Rimward colonies.  Equipped with two drydocks for repairing M-Class freighters, the station also sports four ecological gardens on arms that extend from the station's central stem.

commonName.value: GL537A DELOS (WEYLAND-YUTANI SPINWARD SHIPPING AND DISTRIBUTION CENTER)
commonName.label: Text

affiliation.value: Weyland-Yutani.  Trades with ICSC, UA, and 3WE.
affiliation.label: Affiliation

climate.value: Thin atmosphere (1 to all STAMINA rolls without breathing equipment)
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Frost covered ice world with sporadic deep thermal springs and steam vents
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value: Shipping and distribution facilities on surface, several loading and fuel stations in orbit
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value:
Supplies to the Weyland Isles Sector and other outer colonies are distributed through the barter station at Delos.  Here, freighters take on frontier-mined ores and other cargoes intended for the core systems.  They also bring supplies from the core to the Frontier.

Under normal circumstances, treaties allow civilian freighters to pass through UPP space to reach Delos.  The Frontier War disrupted those routes for nearly two years.  While trade routes have been re-established, Delos has been over-tasked with getting the colonies much needed food, fuel, and medicines.

A strategic asset, Delos is a prime target for an invasion by the New Albion Protectorate.

climate.value: Thick but breathable, hot and humid
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Steamy jungle world with yellow vegetation
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value: Iota Persei is a main sequence star with a system of three worlds.  Only one is the correct distance from the star to support life—and support life it does.  Iota Persei III is a lush jungle world of amber alien plants similar to the foliage discovered by the USCMC on Fujima 514.  A dismissed survey report suggests massive archaeological ruins with equally massive stone heads jutting from the jungle floor lie hidden in the dense banana-yellow foliage.

terrain.value: Pockmarked and cratered metamorphic rock with two-kilometer-deep mine shafts
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value: One, Mining Site B (2,000 miners, 250 support staff)
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value:
This somewhat barren system has a large main sequence variable star orbited by a cold debris disk rich in rare earth metals.  The largest piece of debris is called Ockham's Asteroid—a 12 km wide misshapen rock that sports an ICSC sponsored mining colony.  As the first mining site (A) failed to reach ore, it was the second that was colonized.

Called Mining Site B, the facility has recreation bars, a solarium, and cage accommodation for over 2,000 miners.  A single marshal with a dozen deputies maintains order.

The mine itself is over two kilometers deep, causing a severe change in pressure with any descent.

Rumors persist that something unearthed in that deep mine has caused several accidents amongst the miners, but these reports are unconfirmed.

terrain.value: Wetlands with swamp gas
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value: Research station with several laboratory outposts
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value:
Discovered in 2061 in a cooperative effort between industrialist William Tark and the Weyland Corp, the third planet here is home to numerous colonies of simple xeno-bacteria.  A permanent research facility was established here called Tark-Weyland Station.  The station's microbiological and biochemical engineers have put together a think tank to combat new forms of cancer that do not respond to established treatments.

Recently, Tark-Weyland's Molecular Science Group assigned a think tank to work on developing an antigen that would slow the advance of the black pathogen deployed in the Border Bombers' attacks.

Unfortunately, the project's lead scientists—Professor Hugo Cléas and Doctor Hide Tajima—went missing while attempting to obtain samples of the pathogen.  Their current status is unknown.

terrain.value: Buttes and valleys
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value: During a probe flyby of the KOI-1404 system, the planetoid labeled Archimedes was found to be rich in lithium and chromite deposits—materials necessary for extrasolar vehicle construction.  A surface-based spaceport and starship repair base was established here, making Archimedes a shipping hub between the Far Spinward Colonies and the Outer Veil.

climate.value: Hazy but breathable atmosphere with massive dust storms
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Low flatlands with deep black seas
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value: Ute Colony in the KOI-1430 system was the first to introduce Kelland Mining Company's advanced extrasolar mining technologies and techniques to their mining operations.  Within a month of installation, they had increased their production by 130%.  Ute also processed hydrogen cells from the planet's black seas, making the colony essential to the sector's energy needs.

climate.value: Breathable with vibrant bright skies and dusk-for-night.
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Rough, rocky planet
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
Settled by colonists from Capelli Colony, July Outpost was founded as a manufacturing center on the first planet of the KOI-1739 system.

It soon became the central manufacturing hub for atmosphere processors in the Far Spinward Colonies.  The outpost's industry was so successful they even exported processors back to the Outer Veil colonies.

terrain.value: Deep soupy oceans with underwater geothermal vents
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value: One submersible outpost typically buoyed at the surface with five deep water colonies across the globe
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value:
The primordial water world of KOI-2020.01 is a xenobiologist's dream.  The seafloor is home to pockets of bacterial life essential to medical research.  The colony's seabed operations are divided into industrial sectors for both mining and health.

January Outpost itself sits on the ocean surface—a structure called a Marine Made Mobile Island (M3I).  The M3I is the size of a Bison freighter and able to submerge to a depth of 2,000 meters.  Most research on this world is conducted through the use of EVA Pods ).

terrain.value: Sprawling urban landscape with multiple atmospheric processor mountains
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value: Colonized by engineers, technicians, and environmental specialists, the Capelli Colony in the KOI-2290 system was the first manufacturer of next generation atmosphere processors.  When the planet was found to have an abundance of mineable metals and ores, the colony's population grew past the initial work crews to over a million souls.  Because of fusion reactor safety protocols, atmospheric processor production was moved off world to July Outpost (above).

terrain.value: Northern hemisphere is stratified rock.  Southern is dominated by vast algal biomass covered seas
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
When seen from orbit, KOI-2469.01 was noted for its southern seas' apparent autumn colors.  An outpost was established here in 2069 as a resupply base for further extrasolar expeditions.  When microorganisms were discovered to be the cause of the seas' strange pigmentation, the post was repurposed for scientific research.  A form of alien algae, the organisms were found to have many practical applications ranging from terraforming to a viable food source.

During the colonial food shortages of the latter half of the 21st century, October Outpost became a major food supplier, cultivating algae in floating farms and exporting foodstuffs to both the Outer Veil and the Far Spinward Colonies.

climate.value: Highlands with a thin but breathable atmosphere.  Increased heat and pressure within the kilometer-deep chasms
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Rocky shale, deep chasms and crumbling cliff faces and peninsulas
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
Established in 2067 after nearly a decade of terraforming, this mining colony is named after industrialist and pioneer J.V.  Gorham.  The site of the deepest mining operations ever drilled, Gorham's mine shafts extend some 23 km deep.  At its height, Gorham's Colony reached a population of one million colonists.

By 2108, Gorham had plans to increase mining production by introducing a tunneling creature native to the Outer Rim world Tartarus—the Harvester.  It is unclear if the shipment of Harvesters ever made it to the colony before the FSC were cut off from the Middle Heavens.

climate.value: Still air followed by silicate hurricanes
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Dry sandstone expanses pockmarked with quarries and subterranean lakes
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
Several millions of years ago, KOI-2770.01 collided with an asteroid enriched with large quantities of palladium.  The impact created massive deposits of the mineral which were targeted for exploitation by Weyland Corp.

Instead of simple mining, Izvinite Outpost also had the facilities to refine the precious metal.  Massive sub-surface electrolysis turbine plants are used to break down water molecules into its hydrogen and oxygen components for separate export to other worlds.

climate.value: Breathable with occasional salt-filled stinging winds
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Salt flats and pillars surrounding massive saltwater lakes
terrain.label: Terrain

keyResources.value: Magnesium, lithium, halite, oxygen, and aquaculture
keyResources.label: Key Resources

comment.value: In the latter half of the 21st century, this system housed a major European military base in the Far Spinward Colonies.  When the 3WE was formed in 2088, May Outpost became home to a full Commando of royal marines.  After the Weyland Corporation collapse, many of the marines and colonists returned to the core systems, leaving only a reserve contingent here with their families.

terrain.value: Glacial dry ice pockmarked with geothermal vents
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
Kareti Colony in the KOI-723 system is a prime example of early Weyland Corp pioneers' defiance in the face of a cold and unforgiving universe.  Primitive single-cell organisms were detected living near geothermal vents upon the sixth planet's discovery.  Unfortunately, the company probe incorrectly tagged the planet for colonization.  Instead of a simple scientific expedition, an entire colony mission led by J.V.  Gorham was sent to the world.

Upon arrival, it became clear that its inhospitable carbon-dioxide-rich atmosphere would not lend itself to terraforming.

The atmospheric plant threatened to overload when attempting to scrub the air and the colony's structures failed to keep the infiltrating toxic environment out.

In competition with Eldridge Sanchez over who could put down roots on the more hostile world, Gorham had the plant's processors shut down, vacuum-sealed the facility, and moved the research team in.  The rest of the colonists went on to settle on Sanchez Outpost (above).

terrain.value: Honeycombed caverns throughout craggy mountains and high plateaus
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
Spearheaded by cosmologist and philanthropist Eldridge Dylan Sanchez, the establishment of the system KOI-784 was a long and arduous task.  A systemic failure of the atmospheric processor plant on Dylan City brought a pause to the initial terraforming effort, which was eventually restarted eight years later in 2062.

While an independent science team determined the trouble to be the result of indigenous subterranean single-cell life forms, the company chose to ignore their recommendation to stop colonization.  The process was finally completed by 2069.  A precious metal mining colony, alternately called Dylan City, Dylan Colony, or just Dylan, this world was a thriving center for the Far Spinward Colonies.

terrain.value: Fertile farmlands
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value: One central hub with radiating farms spread far out from each other
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value: While the planets in this system had no flora of their own when colonists arrived a century ago, the soil on KOI-947.01 was found to be exceptionally fertile.  With only a limited amount of terraforming, the colony cultivated a productive agricultural industry.  Pelican Colony became a major food provider in the second half of the 21st century.  When the Far Spinward Colonies were cut off, food prices in the Middle Heavens skyrocketed.  If any FSC worlds continued to thrive after the 20-parsec limit was established, it's likely they would get their foodstuffs from Pelican.

climate.value: Moist, thick, and hard to breath
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Shallow valleys with subterranean seas and low-lying lichen forests
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
Located in unclaimed space, LHS-1140 is a red dwarf star system with three rocky planets.  The planet LHS 1140b is a super-Earth in the habitable zone and transits the star every 24.7 days.

Gravity on the planet is 2G.  Anyone on the surface will have trouble moving around and get a -2 modification to all MOBILITY, CLOSE COMBAT, and STAMINA rolls.  After a period of acclimation (D6 days), this modification disappears.

climate.value: Breathable but stale air with no discernible winds
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Barren mountains, super canyons, and yawning quarries
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value:
One, abandoned.
Planet cleared for recolonization.
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value:
When several mineral assets were discovered in the Omni Ceti system, the fourth planet was colonized by the Omni-tech corporation in 2085.  A domed colony was set on the surface of Mira Ceti IV and terraforming efforts began using traditional techniques.  After 15 years of terraforming and mining, the colony sent out a distress signal.  With their cargo fleet spread thin and no Colonial Coast Guard in place yet, it took the nearest Omni-tech ship four and a half years to respond.

Of the 532 colonists assigned there, only 104 severely mutilated bodies were found.  Investigators concluded the colony succumbed to a mass hysteria that resulted in deaths and rioting.  Panicked survivors must have fled into the cata­combs and wastelands and died of exposure there.  Conspiracy theorists claim the colony was attacked by technologically advanced alien lifeforms, who killed those who resisted and took the others back to their home world as slaves.  

The recently leaked journals of a colonist named Lumley suggest that a demonic entity was summoned and dragged the missing colonists back to hell with it.  While pure nonsense, the journals have revived interest in the Tulitu esoteric brotherhood that Lumley belonged to.

commonName.value: PYLOS, ATOL SPHACTERIA FUEL DEPOT AND WAYSTATION
commonName.label: Text

climate.value: Planet atmosphere is toxic, station air is recycled through old scrubbers and tastes like tin
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Pressurized ammonia and methane gasses
terrain.label: Terrain

population.value: 48 workers and 40 UNISC troops on station
population.label: Population

comment.value:
Pylos is a gas giant situated in a forgotten and secluded part of space.  The United Nations Interstellar Settlement Corps set up space station ATOL Sphacteria orbiting Pylos here to act as a spinward Frontier fuel depot.  A Colonial Marshal's office and a platoon of UNISC troops are stationed on Sphacteria.  Along with its massive fuel pods, this depot has two internal drydocks and outer docking facilities for up to twelve class F to M starships.

The station is neutral, servicing all nations and ships alike.  The station's central tower maintains two extendable fuel grapplers that can capture a ship and pull it in for refueling.  A Lockmart towing shuttle is docked here to assist in starship repairs.

affiliation.value: 3WE research world leased to Bionational and Weyland-Yutani
affiliation.label: Affiliation

climate.value: Harmful aerosols and poisonous gasses.  Simple rebreathers required.
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Green seas and volcanic islands
terrain.label: Terrain

colonies.value:
One, abandoned.
Rotating scientific expeditions, typically 648 explorers and scientists at any time
colonies.label: Colonies

comment.value:
The POL-6362 system features a world named for Weyland Corp's Jacob-Tellis expedition.

This primordial world was settled in 2071, but its small colonial outpost was abandoned when Weyland Corp stocks fell in the 2090s.  Covered in volcanic ash, its structures still stand on an equatorial island chain.  The planet is home to numerous forms of aquatic xeno-microfauna.  Science teams from Tark-Weyland Station make several expeditions here every year, collecting and cataloging microscopic protozoa and arthropods.

climate.value: Breathable. electric storms, dry with sporadic flash floods
climate.label: Climate

terrain.value: Red sand-deserts and jutting spires
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value: This binary system consists of a main sequence star (Theta Persei A) and its red dwarf companion (Theta Persei B). While this system has been noted for the possibility of earth-like planets in the star's habitable zones, only one has been cataloged—a dead rock with a red sand desert moon designated LV-139. High temperatures dominate the day with freezing temperatures at night. Blue lightning electric storms are common. Other than the moon, Theta Persei has strangely remained unexplored for nearly a century.

commonName.value: DYBBUK (SAFFAR, SAMH, DSMO JOE ONE, TWO AND THREE TRAWLING PLATFORMS)
commonName.label: Text

terrain.value: Fold mountains and rolling hills
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
Upsilon Andromedae is a binary star system of a main sequence star and a red dwarf.  There are three gas giants—Saffar, Samh and Majriti, and a hidden fourth planet (Dybbuk) lurking within the system's solar ionized radiation belt.

The gas giants are home to three Working Joe-run trawling platforms designated DSMO Joe One, Two, and Three.  These stations process metallic hydrogen and metallic helium from the gas giants' cores.

terrain.value: Ever-branching tributaries and river deltas crisscrossing plains and basins
terrain.label: Terrain

comment.value:
Named after famous cosmologist and philanthropist Eldridge D. Sanchez, Sanchez Outpost's industry featured arrays of automated deep mining machines.  While it started as a small outpost, within a few years it had become a sprawling colony powered by a substantial dam system.  In addition to the Outpost, this system is known for the massive gas giants Ojo and Atomos and the many moons that surround them.

In 2105, the last message transmitted from the outpost was from Sanchez himself, proclaiming an in-system discovery that in his own words would, “change human life as we know it.” What that was remains a mystery to this day.

You are around other people all the time, watching, observing, and your attention to detail is second to none. You never fail to spot people cheating at cards, and other little things that happen around you. You gain a +2 modification to any OBSERVATION test relating to sleight of hand or spotting concealed items on a person.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: Vehicle systems, life-support, colony functions and all types of machines break down just when you need them most, but you’re used to it. You can make a HEAVY MACHINERY roll as a slow action to cajole, massage, pray or use kind words to make an otherwise broken machine work for just a moment longer. The number of successes multiplied by two determines how many Rounds the machine will continue to operate, with a minimum of 1, before it splutters its last in a plume of black smoke.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: You can use COMMAND to create a beguiling artistic performance, so much so that those watching are captivated. You can hold a target’s attention for one round per success on your roll. They suffer a −3 modification to any OBSERVATION tests during this time.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: You are an expert prospector and can sniff out rich resources better than anyone. When prospecting, you roll twice on the Prospecting Finds table and keep the best result.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: You have a canny knack for seeing the terrain in a way no one else can, and getting your vehicle safely where it needs to go. You gain +2 to all PILOTING rolls when driving a ground or submersible vehicle.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: You have a trusting face and smile, and people warm to you. Gain a +2 modification to MANIPULATION tests whenever you are trying to gain someone’s trust.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: You exude authority, from your personality, your position in the Company, your place on the command team or because the force of law is behind you. If you fail a COMMAND roll you can immediately, as a free action, attempt a MANIPULATION roll to try and salvage the situation.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: You understand what drives pack behavior and how people tend to function as a group. With a successful OBSERVATION roll you can predict the short-term attitude or behavior of a group of people. You get to ask the GM a question about the group, and they must offer you some insight (more detail with extra successes) into what they are going to do as a group.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: Your resilience allows you to block out the bad things going on around you. Once per Shift you can use your signature item to reduce the Panic total you suffer by D6 points. This does not stop you from using the signature item to reduce your STRESS LEVEL as usual.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: You have grown up with animals or have been extensively trained. You can manage livestock, control dogs, and even handle a manacled Harvester with the right equipment. You can use SURVIVAL to force animals to follow simple instructions, and you are skilled in the use of harnesses and electro-prods to handle Harvesters without the usual negative modifier for using such equipment.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: Your discipline and attention to detail gives you the ability to block out the outside world and focus on the task at hand. You gain a +2 modification to any task that takes at least a Turn or a Shift to complete, but if you are interrupted you automatically fail the task and must start again.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: With a Turn of work, you can make a one-use item from scrap and parts you find lying around (at the GM’s discretion). The number of successes beyond the first determines any positive skill roll modifier of the item.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: Your ability to use heavy machines to unearth the most fragile of artifacts is second to none. You gain a +2 modification to HEAVY MACHINERY rolls when operating, rather than repairing or building, a machine.
comment.label: Text

comment.value: A born orator and public speaker, you can talk to a crowd and make every person think you are talking just to them, and them alone. Rather than suffering a negative modifier to your COMMAND or MANIPULATION rolls when out-numbered, you gain a +1 modification instead.
comment.label: Text

comment.value:
Scans one zone per Round.

Sometimes called "Pups," these cost-prohibitive mapping devices have been in use for a good hundred years. Pups employ limited ani-gravity propulsion to float through, across, and over otherwise difficult to navigate terrain. As these orbs scout about, they constantly scan a 360-degree area around the device with mapping lasers. The Pups then send the spectrograph information back to a synced device, usually a starship or ground-based HoloTab or a monitoring station in a mobile command vehicle. They can also detect lifeforms, atmospheric conditions, toxins and more. Pups were given their nickname because they emit a haunting, hound-like howling sound as they seek and scan. They can scan one zone per Round and detect any enemies in zones they pass. Range Extreme.
comment.label: Text
